abstract.p: Ryder Ripps, 14, makes lampshades from Silpat baking sheets; photo (S)

block.p: Ryder Ripps, 14, may have a propensity for design. His mother, Helene Verin, designs interiors, furniture and shoes. His father, Rodney Ripps, is an artist. So, it wasn't a huge leap for Ryder, left, to feel inspired to transform Silpat baking sheets, a Martha Stewart favorite made of pliable heat-resistant plastic, into lampshades.

''They're translucent, and when you put them up to the light, the light shines through,'' Ryder said. He folded the cream-colored sheets into cylinders, stapled them lengthwise and attached them by wires to hanging braided lamp cords.
